info.title: Adding new SSL/TLS certificates to a system-wide CA certificate store

topic.para: To let applications know about a new SSL/TLS certificate on the system, add the certificate to a system-wide certificate store and use the update-ca-certificates command to update it.

listitem.para: The ca-certificate package is installed on the system.

step.para: Copy the certificate file to the /etc/pki/trust/anchors directory.
Verify that you certificate has been added to the certificate store by listing all known trust anchors.
step.screen:
&prompt.sudo;trust list pkcs11:id=%E6%E7%38%36%9E%F3%39%6C%F0%D8%09%6C%AB%12%90%04%AE%7D%C3%6F;type=cert type: certificate label: www.example.org trust: anchor category: other-entry
[...]

listitem.para: The man 1 trust manual page describes how to use the trust command to list, extract, add, remove or change trust anchors.
